actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 11:00 a.m. on October 24, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Womack moved that the House do now adjourn.
Mr. Womack asked unanimous consent That when the House adjourns on Friday, October 20, 2023, it adjourn to meet at 11:00 a.m. on Tuesday, October 24, 2023. Agreed to without objection.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of October 20.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

actions-list.header: ANNOUNCEMENT OF RESULT OF ROLL CALL 525
actions-list.actionItem: The Chair announced that no persons having received a majority of the whole number of votes cast by surname in the Election of the Speaker, a Speaker was not elected.

Election of the Speaker, Mr. Jordan 194, Mr. Jeffries 210, Mr. Scalise 8, Mr. McHenry 6, Mr. Zeldin 4, Mr. Donalds 2, Mr. McCarthy 2, Mr. Garcia, Mike 1, Mr. Emmer 1, and Mr. Westerman 1 (Roll no. 525).

The Honorable Kevin McCarthy, by direction of the Republican Conference, nominated the Honorable Jim Jordan, a Member from the State of Ohio. The Honorable Katherine M. Clark (MA), by direction of the Democratic Caucus, nominated the Honorable Hakeem Jeffries, a Member from the State of New York. No other nominations were put forward.

actions-list.header: ORDER OF BUSINESS-ELECTION OF THE SPEAKER
actions-list.actionItem: The Chair announced that the floor was open to receive nominations for the Office of the Speaker of the U.S. House of Representatives.
Call of the House Quorum responded: 427 present (Roll no. 524).

Pursuant to clause 7 of rule XX, Mr. Johnson (LA) moved a call of the House. The Speaker announced that under clause 7(b) of rule XX, he conferred recognition for that purpose and that without objection, a call of the House would be ordered.
The Chair designated Mr. Bost to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Reverend Ryan Coffey, First Baptist Church, Somerset, Kentucky.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
